props.value: Disable Kernel Support for USB via Bootloader Configuration

props.name: Parameter_Description_0
props.value: The directory where the user files with the failure records are kept

props.name: Parameter_Description_1
props.value:
Type of policy in use. Possible values are:
targeted - Only targeted network daemons are protected.
strict - Full SELinux protection.
mls - Multiple levels of security

props.name: Parameter_Description_2
props.value:
enforcing - SELinux security policy is enforced.
permissive - SELinux prints warnings instead of enforcing.
disabled - SELinux is fully disabled.

implemented-requirements.description:
Section 2: System accounts do not always have a group
Section 4 is a manual control
Section 5 this cant be checked on a per system base, and therefore is an organizational control

This should be the default on all modern platforms
Section 2: organizational requirement towards the admin

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: This requirement must be implemented organizationally.

implemented-requirements.description:
Section 2: System accounts do not always have a group
Section 4 is a manual control
Section 5 this cant be checked on a per system base, and therefore is an organizational control

This should be the default on all modern platforms
Section 2: organizational requirement towards the admin

props.name: implementation-status
props.remarks: This requirement must be implemented organizationally.
